result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean M Hogan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid in 60 days or penalty of 7 days jail for non-payment with 1 day sentence credit.
Resitution to be determined at future hearing.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean M Hogan

records.addlTxt: Attorney Michael J Steinle in court.   Defendant Sean M Hogan did not appear.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for restitution hearing.  Clerk tried to call victim at Racine Correctional but there was no one at numbers provided (connections was made but Defendant was not there).  Court sets restitution at -0-.  Court will allow victim 60 days to respond if he objects.  Check Case scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 07:45 am.
Restitution hearing at 04-07-2016 03:30 pm

Defendant Sean M Hogan in court with Attorney Michael J Steinle.  Kevin Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case called for restitution hearing.  Victim was to appear by videoconference, however he was not available.  State is still requesting $500.00 restitution.  Attorney Steinle requests restitution be set at -0-.  Court adjourns and will allow victim (Terrance T. Frehr) to appear by videoconference from Racine Correctional.  Court waives Defendant's appearance for next date.  Restitution hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Restitution hearing at 03-02-2016 10:30 am
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Sean M Hogan in court with Attorney Michael J Steinle.  Lesli Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations and also requests restitution in the amount of $500.00 and requests a restitution hearing.  Attorney Steinle makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  FINE:  $379.00 - to be paid in 60 days, alternate 7 days jail if not paid (1 day credit).  Restitution hearing scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Sean M Hogan in court with Attorney Michael J Steinle.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steinle states they are ready to proceed to trial on Tuesday, 1/12/16.  Court leaves jury trial on.
COPY of order to produce witness (Terrance Frehr) filed by the DA.   Signed by Judge Carter on 01/04/16.
Jury trial - 12 person at 01-12-2016 08:30 am
Jury status hearing at 01-07-2016 09:30 am

Defendant Sean M Hogan in court with Attorney Michael J Steinle.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Steinle requests a jury status and jury trial date.    Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Hearing at 10-01-2015 08:30 am
Hearing at 09-25-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Sean M Hogan in court with Attorney Michael J Steinle.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steinle requests an adjourned date 30 days out.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on August 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Sean M Hogan in court.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.
